camel.sink.path.resourceUri.name: camel.sink.path.resourceUri
camel.sink.path.resourceUri.description: Path to the resource. You can prefix with: classpath, file, http, ref, or bean. classpath, file and http loads the resource using these protocols (classpath is default). ref will lookup the resource in the registry. bean will call a method on a bean to be used as the resource. For bean you can specify the method name after dot, eg bean:myBean.myMethod.

camel.sink.endpoint.allowContextMapAll.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowContextMapAll
camel.sink.endpoint.allowContextMapAll.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.

camel.sink.endpoint.allowTemplateFromHea.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowTemplateFromHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.allowTemplateFromHea.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.

camel.sink.endpoint.configuration.name: camel.sink.endpoint.configuration
camel.sink.endpoint.configuration.description: Sets the Freemarker configuration to use

camel.sink.endpoint.contentCache.name: camel.sink.endpoint.contentCache
camel.sink.endpoint.contentCache.description: Sets whether to use resource content cache or not

camel.sink.endpoint.encoding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.encoding
camel.sink.endpoint.encoding.description: Sets the encoding to be used for loading the template file.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.templateUpdateDelay.name: camel.sink.endpoint.templateUpdateDelay
camel.sink.endpoint.templateUpdateDelay.description: Number of seconds the loaded template resource will remain in the cache.

camel.component.freemarker.allowContextM.name: camel.component.freemarker.allowContextMapAll
camel.component.freemarker.allowContextM.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.

camel.component.freemarker.allowTemplate.name: camel.component.freemarker.allowTemplateFromHeader
camel.component.freemarker.allowTemplate.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.

camel.component.freemarker.lazyStartProd.name: camel.component.freemarker.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.freemarker.lazyStartProd.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.freemarker.localizedLook.name: camel.component.freemarker.localizedLookup
camel.component.freemarker.localizedLook.description: Enables/disables localized template lookup. Disabled by default.

camel.component.freemarker.autowiredEnab.name: camel.component.freemarker.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.freemarker.autowiredEnab.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.freemarker.configuration.name: camel.component.freemarker.configuration
camel.component.freemarker.configuration.description: To use an existing freemarker.template.Configuration instance as the configuration.
